title: Calculate Desert Water Requirements
brief: Determine daily water needs based on temperature and activity level in desert conditions.
steps: Step 1: Understand that at 43Â°C (110Â°F) doing hard work in sun requires 19 liters of water daily.
Step 2: For temperatures below 38Â°C (100Â°F), drink 0.5 liters of water every hour.
Step 3: For temperatures above 38Â°C (100Â°F), drink 1 liter of water every hour.
Step 4: Adjust intake based on activity level - more work requires more water.
Step 5: Do not wait for thirst - it only indicates 2/3 of actual water needs.
Step 6: Drink at regular intervals even with limited water supply.
warnings: Do not ration water - this leads to heat casualties.
Thirst is not a reliable indicator of water needs.
A person performing hard work at 43Â°C without adequate water will quickly become incapacitated.
